profileAlternative.name: Yaakov Chaikin
profileAlternative.headline: Teaching WebDev to Thousands @Coursera & @JHU Grad School, Senior Software Dev @Envieta, author, speaker
profileAlternative.summary:
Teaching Web Dev to (hundreds of) THOUSANDS on Coursera.org! Exciting!
Sign up! It's FREE!

HTML, CSS, and Javascript for Web Developers:
https://www.coursera.org/learn/html-css-javascript-for-web-developers

Single Page Web Applications with AngularJS:
https://www.coursera.org/learn/single-page-web-apps-with-angularjs

Both courses reached #1 Top Rated Course on Coursera.org!

Software Development
My regular consulting involves directly interfacing with customers, designing software architectures (or fixing broken ones), and leading software teams where I get involved in all aspects of development, from requirements analysis to coding implementations (usually web-based ones).

Teaching WebDev
I've done quite a bit of teaching. As a part-time graduate faculty at Johns Hopkins University for over 12 years, I've been trying to bring real-world experience teaching Java Enterprise Edition Web Development as well as Rich Internet Applications with Ajax. I have also been hired to give presentations and teach short courses for commercial clients.

I am a Certified ScrumMaster, co-authored a book, teach in grad school, train developers, volunteer, and do public speaking.

I also like to learn and apply marketing principles as well as enjoy photography (which I don't have any time for lately. :-) ) - https://www.linkedin.com/redir/invalid-link-page?url=http%3A%2F%2Fis%2egd%2FQh5qWl

(** NOT interested in outsourcing inquiries **)

positions.title:
Title
Graduate Computer Science Adjunct Faculty
positions.description: Teaching and developing curriculum for live as well as online graduate level courses in Web Development with Java as well Rich Internet Application with Ajax.

positions.title: Director of Engineering & Senior Software Architect
Graduate Web Development Track Administrator & Adjunct Faculty
positions.description: Founder and administrator of the track, overseeing track’s progress. Shaping the track by developing new courses, curriculum, recruiting new instructors as well as teaching Web Development related courses.

given.text: I participated in one of the AngularJS course taught by Yaakov and I must say he did an excellent job providing high quality course with lots of good tips and good material. Not only was the course beneficial but it was funny and very practical as well. Highly recommend him.
Yaakov is very detail-oriented and produced great results for the students he mentored in web development though which i benefited immensely I humbly recommend him anytime.

I followed M.Yaakov great performance on Coursera lately and I can say that I met a wonderful teacher anticipating most learners difficulties before even they felt them. Hope he will impress us more with other great courses specially on Hybrid mobile App and Cloud dedicated applications.
Yaakov prepared this course in the very comprehensive way. suitable for anyone who is interested in web developpement
The course that Yaakov has worked on and put up is very clear and precise. He covers the topics in a precise way and I highly recommend it to those starting out.

Yaakov has prepared one of the best and well-structured courses on the basics of web development with HTML5, CSS and JavaScript. With great pleasure I took this course and highly recommend Yaakov as highly qualified lecturer and trainer.
Mr Yaakov haves one of the most well-designed and explained courses on learning HTML and CSS on the web. I certainly do recommend his ability to teach efficiently.

I've had the pleasure of attending tutorial by Yaakov on HTML 5, CSS3 and Java script. The way he explains is totally amazing, if someone is looking to learn or want fall in love with coding, do attend his tutorial. He is simply awesome.

I turned to Yaakov more than once for input and recommendations regarding software solutions. Despite a crowded environment cluttered with options, he was able to quickly identify an ideal solution. Yaakov is smart, personable, and has a broad and deep expertise in technology and software. His knowledge, insight, and ability to zero in on best practices is extraordinary. I highly recommend him.
…
See more

I've had the pleasure of working with Yaakov for nearly two years on a team of four engineers on which he was the lead. Yaakov had a very clear vision of our task and found unique ways to move our efforts forward. His technical expertise as well as his ability to lead others provided a highly productive and pleasant work environment. I've known Yaakov to be honest, innovative, hard-working, knowledgeable, and easy to work with. Given the opportunity, I would work with him again.
…
See more
Yaakov has done an excellent job of guiding our graduate program's web development track. His drive to stay current in this fast changing field is a real asset to the program.

I had the pleasure of working with Yaakov on some of the projects at the Johns Hopkins University's Engineering for Professionals program. His broad knowledge of computer science in general and J2EE topics in particular is eclipsed only by the burning passion he brings to the projects he works on.

received.text: I had Jason as a student in a couple of my Johns Hopkins University graduate courses. He was also one of the first TAs in one of my Coursera courses and helped students from all over the world by answering questions about the course material. Jason has a passion for technology and it shows. He is a capable software developer who is not afraid to jump into an uncharted territory and drive it until he gets it done.

I had the pleasure of having Evan in my Rich Internet Application with Ajax class at Johns Hopkins University. He showed a passion for learning new things without fear of very challenging problems, evidenced by his enthusiasm for very hard bonus problems on homework assignments.

items: Core Servlets and Javaserver Pages: Advanced Technologies
